connector.description:
Send data for invoking a knowledge base from AWS Bedrock.

The basic authentication method for the Bedrock service is to specify an access key and a secret key. These parameters are optional because the Kamelet provides a default credentials provider.

If you use the default credentials provider, the Bedrock client loads the credentials through this provider and doesn't use the basic authentication method.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.modelId
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: The model Id to be used to generate responses.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.knowledgeBaseId
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: The Knowledge Base Id to be used to retrieve and generate responses.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: The access key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: The secret key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: If true, the Bedrock client loads credentials through a default credentials provider. If false, it uses the basic authentication method (access key and secret key).

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.useProfileCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: Set whether the Bedrock client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.useSessionCredentials
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: Set whether the Bedrock client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in situation in which the user needs to assume a IAM role for doing operations in Bedrock.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.profileCredentialsName
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.sessionToken
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume a IAM role.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.uriEndpointOverride
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: The overriding endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also select the `overrideEndpoint` option.

camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.name: camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-sink.overrideEndpoint
camel.kamelet.aws-bedrock-agent-runtime-.description: Select this option to override the endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also provide a URI for the `uriEndpointOverride` option.
